author: Lars Thompson
comment: Like the watchface, but Avast Antivirus identifies it as a serious threat.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: Thanks for your review, I'm sorry to hear that this has been labeled as a threat, the app has no malicious intent. Could you let me know which antivirus app you are using so I can look into resolving this?

author: Brian Shappee
comment: My Antivirus (not Avast, like a previous reviewer stated) also indicated that this well done and whimsical watch-face contained known Malicious Code.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: Thanks for your review, I'm currently trying to resolve this issue. Could you let me know what Antivirus application you are using?

author: Ben Chuba
comment: Like this a lot but would love the option to add a background, watch feels a bit empty with all the black

author: Frank Brower
comment: I like it, but the time in 12hr isn't showing am/pm correctly

author: Josh Rose
comment: All fixed. Still getting used to that Wear 2.0 works.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: Hi there, it appears that on wear 2.0 you have to install watch faces from the watch itself. From the on-watch play store you can see apps that you have installed on your  phone and can install them onto the watch. This is the same for all watch faces.

author: Joseph Longden
comment: I installed and instantly gained a 6 pack. 10/10 would install again.

author: Heath Forney
comment: So far it's a great watch face, now that I'm updated to 2.0 however I cannot figure out how to get the battery indicator on. There isn't a way to access it from the phone.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: The battery indicator was added in version 1.6 which has been slowly rolling out. It should be available to everyone in the next couple of days. Thanks for your review!

author: John-Paul M Jeffers
comment: This face is highly customizable and very functional. People who see it are always fascinated by the animation and want to see the bricks fall over and over. My only complaint is that there is no way to add any sort of watch battery indicator to the face. As someone coming from Facer I may have been a bit spoiled by some of the battery and weather indicators that are typically part of the faces available.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: Thanks for the review! A watch battery indicator is a good suggestion, you may see that in the future.

title: Best watch face!

author: Joshua Hibbert
comment: tells you the time but builds it out of tetras pieces. never takes that long that the times wrongs. so cool
title: q

author: Stefan Marchhart
comment: Really cool watchface that draws the time in tetriminos every minute.  More than capable of lasting through the day. My two gripes are, not being able to switch between 24 and 12 hour time,  and no date display.  If you can get past those minor annoyances,  then this is the watchface for you.

reply.author: birdy
reply.content: Thanks for the review! Date and time format options were added in recent updates.

title: Tetris!

author: Ryan Clayton
comment: Very nice and very fun watchface.  I got compliments all weekend on it whereas normally no one even notices my watch.  I also like the options to change the time format and customizing the animation.

author: Nick Wong
comment: TetrominoWear is a watchface with a decent amount of options.  I would really like it if you could customize the colors by piece.  Classic mode is too monochrome while Minimal is too colorful IMO.  Modern adds even more colors (Purple, etc.) which I'm not personally a fan of.  I really like the watchface but personally prefer one with more info on it.

author: Lyndon Fawcett
comment: Brilliant Tetris styled watch face. Bringing back the retro style along with nostalgia from playing Tetris.  Well polished with plenty of customisability; works perfectly on the Huawei smart watch.

author: Kris Bahr
comment: Does exactly what it looks like. And that's awesome. Works well on LG Urbane.
title: Tetris time

author: Scott Bennett
comment: I love this watch face and the developer is very responsive
title: Great Face.

comment: Kinda cool but hard to see when the display is in aod mode
